chargeHist.descr: Possess with Intent to Deliver Non-Narcotics (Acetaminophen and Hydrocodone)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry E. THOMAS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to follow all doctor's orders.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only.

Additional twenty-five (25) days jail, under the Huber Law, on count 1 only, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry E. THOMAS

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was discharged from probation effective 03-21-17.

State files an Amended Information charging 2 cts. Possess Controlled Substance, contrary to Section 961.41(3g)(b) and 2 cts. Possess Controlled Substance, contrary to Section 450.11(7)(h) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
Guilty pleas to all charges.   Convicted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 09-21-15 at 4:00 p.m.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 05-05-15 at 10:30 a.m.

Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with D.A. is set for 03-24-15 at 3:30 p.m.
Minutes.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
Arraignment is set for 03-13-15 at 9:15 a.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-25-15 at 1:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
RE:  Possess with intent to deliver non-narcotics, on 01-09-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess non-narcotic with intent to deliver.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-09-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs, other than those legally prescribed.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
